explanation: The time complexity is O(n) because the function contains a for-loop that iterates 'n' times in order to calculate the factorial of 'n'. This means that as the input size grows, the run time will increase linearly. Space complexity is O(1) since no additional data structures are used and it uses only constant space regardless of input size (only a few integer variables).
